info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:22PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Bertie, eastern Northampton and western Hertford Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers with gusty winds over Scotland Neck, or 11 miles southwest of Rich Square, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong storm will be near... Roxobel around 330 PM EDT. Rich Square, Aulander and Woodland around 335 PM EDT. Murfreesboro, Chowan University and Conway around 345 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Eagletown, Milwaukee, Pendleton, Kelford, Potecasi, Menola, Lasker, Mapleton, Union and Bryantown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.
